title: How can film studios know the exact release date of a movie 2 years in advance? - Quora

response.answer_text: It’s not that they know, they plan these dates and coordinate with theaters. Movie release dates are very competitive and one week earlier or later can have a huge impact on box office. Blockbuster films often have specific dates, such as the last Star Wars films, Mission Impossible, James Bond, etc. However everything’s up in the air due to Covid right now.

They can’t. but they can use project management tools to estimate how long it will take to write, prep, film, edit and promote the film. So most of the time they get it right but some times things go wrong and it takes longer and even more common is a film isn’t good because they rushed the process to meet the release date.
